intro: Sidalcea covillei, commonly known as Coville's checkermallow, is a perennial herb native to the western United States. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant features showy, pink to purple flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. Its leaves are palmately lobed and covered in fine, silky hairs. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in rocky or open habitats.
